WET-BOEW (Web Experience Toolkit) is an open-source front-end framework developed by the Government of Canada to help create accessible, user-friendly, and responsive websites. It provides a set of reusable components, design patterns, and tools to ensure consistency and compliance with accessibility standards like WCAG. WET-BOEW is widely used in government and public sector websites to enhance web accessibility and improve the overall user experience.
